definition: to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)

sentences.english: They might be required information for the approval or rejection decision.
sentences.chinese: 他们在决定审批或拒绝时可能需要这些信息。

sentences.english: Replacing thiomersal in vaccines would require regulatory approval.
sentences.chinese: 替换疫苗中的硫柳汞还需要管制审批。

sentences.english: Liaising and expediting approval of the quotation with the client.
sentences.chinese: 联系客户，并加快对客户报价的审批。

sentences.english: The Shareholder shall cause the Company to report such appointment to the original examination and approval authority for the record.
sentences.chinese: 股东应责成公司将该委任报原审批机关备案。

sentences.english: Such advance studies can greatly expedite regulatory approval.
sentences.chinese: 这种预先研究可以大大加快管制审批。

sentences.english: The new US$100 million funding is subject to approval by the World Bank's Board of Directors.
sentences.chinese: 1亿美元追加资金需经世行董事会审批。

sentences.english: Victor Li said that at present, have all been through the project planning approval.
sentences.chinese: 李泽钜表示，目前项目规划已经全部通过审批。

sentences.english: Article 21: The establishment of a branch by a company with an investment nature shall be submitted to the Ministry of Commerce for examination and approval.
sentences.chinese: 第二十一条投资性公司设立分支机构应报商务部审批。

sentences.english: Today's approval of new drugs in the international community needs to carry out the raw data transmission.
sentences.chinese: 如古旧药的审批须要反在邦际间入行本初数据的传输。

sentences.english: Some 200 more are believed to be awaiting approval.
sentences.chinese: 据信，还有大约200家机构正等待审批。

sentences.english: Approval of construction of the heliport to go through and above the provincial level government, and military.
sentences.chinese: 修建直升机场的审批要经过省级以上政府，以及军方。

sentences.english: All expenses or applications of expenses have to be approved by the budget holders.
sentences.chinese: 所有借支或费用报销均需由预算控制人审批。

sentences.english: His application has been sent up for approval.
sentences.chinese: 他的申请已经送上去审批。

sentences.english: The approver considers and decides whether to reject the loan application or not.
sentences.chinese: 由审批人综合判断是否应拒绝该申请。

sentences.english: Serious efforts were made to implement Law of Administrative Licensing and deepen the reform of administrative approval system .
sentences.chinese: 认真贯彻行政许可法，深化行政审批制度改革。

sentences.english: We will continue to separate government functions from enterprise management, reduce the number of matters requiring administrative examination and approval, and standardize procedures for doing so.
sentences.chinese: 继续推进政企分开，减少和规范行政许可和行政审批。

definition: to report for criticism/to submit for approval to higher authority
to reply officially to a subordinate
official written ruling in response to a submission/official approval in writing
to report for judgment/to submit for approval
to report to one's superiors/to appear in the news/to reply to a letter
preliminary hearing/interrogation (of a suspect)/preliminary examination (of a project etc)
to report (to the authorities)/to declare (to customs)
to accept to hear a case/to handle (a service)
